intro: Eriogonum fulvum, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, spherical seed pods that mature in the fall. Eriogonum fulvum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
